definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: He frightened the old lady into signing the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他恐嚇那位老太太簽了字據。

sentences.english: Yes, it is a receipt for money .
sentences.chinese: 明白，那是一張收款的字據。

sentences.english: When someone borrows money from me, I usually ask for an IOU.
sentences.chinese: 別人向我借錢時一般都會請求立字據。

sentences.english: No man will be able to board a plane without a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 沒有字據的人將不得登上飛機。

sentences.english: However, this does not give the whole compounding disputes writings ends.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這張私了字據並未給整個糾紛畫上句號。

sentences.english: TangLi said calculate borrow to also go to field in the day make a written evidence.
sentences.chinese: 唐力說算借也行要給田在天立個字據。
